thread.title: Thunderbowl Lanes tightens security after brawl caught on viral video
thread.title_full: Thunderbowl Lanes tightens security after brawl caught on viral video

author: Detroit Free Press
title: Thunderbowl Lanes tightens security after brawl caught on viral video
text:
Thunderbowl Lanes tightens security after brawl caught on viral video Video shows 8 men fighting and a young woman being punched during the melee in Allen Park 'Bowling for Dollars' alley Post to Facebook Thunderbowl Lanes tightens security after brawl caught on viral video Video shows 8 men fighting and a young woman being punched during the melee in Allen Park 'Bowling for Dollars' alley   Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2m5Pjzq   Join the Conversation To   Thunderbowl Lanes tightens security after brawl caught on viral video Perry A. Farrell , Detroit Free Press 8:02 p.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 Buy Photo Sean Rash of Montgomery, Ill., competes in the 2016 PBA Detroit Open championship at Thunderbowl Lanes in Allen Park, Mich. on Sunday, Sept. 11, 2016. (Photo: Kimberly P. Mitchell DFP) Buy Photo CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Thunderbowl Lanes, a popular Allen Park bowling center and venue for the long-running “Bowling for Dollars” TV show, is taking tighter security measures after a brawl over the weekend that was captured on a video that went viral. 
The video shows eight men fighting and a young woman being punched during the melee in a room just off the arena. 
“There were four police departments that were called,’’ said Mike Calloway, marketing director for the Thunderbowl, which often hosts Professional Bowling Association tournaments.
